Articles.Content: So i've been working on a rover and I use 2 RoveMax model XL3 wheels on the front and 4 on the back. Everything is fine except the fact that I can't steer the rover. I looked at other people's posts and everyone says to use diffrent wheels but for me that's not an option since my rover is big and heavy. I tried to put reaction wheels but it just turns it ever so slightly. Can somebody help me?

1 hour ago, StarDroid_5000 said:

So i've been working on a rover and I use 2 RoveMax model XL3 wheels on the front and 4 on the back. Everything is fine except the fact that I can't steer the rover. I looked at other people's posts and everyone says to use diffrent wheels but for me that's not an option since my rover is big and heavy. I tried to put reaction wheels but it just turns it ever so slightly. Can somebody help me?

Hi stardroid. Had this problem myself yesterday but with the medium wheels. Just had a look and on medium wheels you can turn off auto steering adjust that sorted it. Can't find that option on the XL3. Probably worth filling out a bug report. Maybe they will add the auto steering adjust setting to these too.The medium wheels can take a fair bit of weight. I made a 600 + part bus ( in the craft exchange) on four of them and manually adjusted the suspension settings. That came in at 360+ tons if that's any help. Sorry I can't be of any more help
